info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 15 at 3:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Taos Avalanche Center. The Taos Avalanche Center in Taos has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch. * WHAT...The avalanche danger is currently considered Considerable. A significant winter storm will impact the northern mountains of New Mexico tonight into Friday and may increase the avalanche danger to High at all elevations Thursday, March 16th, 2023. * WHERE...Wheeler Peak Wilderness Area and Columbine Hondo Wilderness above 9500 feet. * WHEN... In effect from Wednesday 1500 MDT to Thursday 0800 MDT. * IMPACTS...A significant winter storm is on tap tonight into Friday, March 17th where we could see upwards of 2 to 3 feet of snow and strong winds. Large dangerous natural and human- triggered avalanches are likely through the day Thursday. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Careful snowpack evaluation, cautious route finding and conservative decision-making are essential for travel in the backcountry today. This Avalanche Watch is scheduled to expire on 0800 on March 16th. Check back with the Taos Avalanche Center to see if the Avalanche Watch is extended, or upgraded to an Avalanche Warning tomorrow morning. Consult http://www.taosavalanchecenter.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
